page.title: 19RED ROSE RADIO, PRESTON
page.content: Red Rose Radio station is in a central position in Preston, that is why the site was purchased. It cost Â£35,000 to buy a church which had been derelict for 15 years. In 1981 they decided to use this church and it cost Â£780,000 to change it into a radio station. It took 4 months to convert it into the Red Rose studio. The first words spoken were by the chairman. The station has many people working there. There are at least 12 D.J's employed. The station has 4 studios. Studio 1 is the main studio, Studio 2 is the recording studio, Studio 3 is the news studio and Studio 4 is for recording advertisements. Red Rose gets all of its money from these adverts, and is the only commercial radio station in the area.
